item.title: RT by @EverydaySexism: üßµLucia* came to our service seeking support as she was experiencing gender-based abuse. Eight days after reporting to the police, she got an immigration enforcement letter confirming her abuser's threats. Lucia was not seen as a victim but as an immigration offender. 1/6

item.description:

item.title: Every time Laurence Fox says something reprehensible, it is Billie Piper's name, not his, that trends on Twitter. Now Prue Leith is trending instead of her anti-abortion MP son Danny Kruger. Stop blaming women for what the men in their lives do #EverydaySexism
item.dc:creator: @EverydaySexism
item.description: Every time Laurence Fox says something reprehensible, it is Billie Piper's name, not his, that trends on Twitter. Now Prue Leith is trending instead of her anti-abortion MP son Danny Kruger. Stop blaming women for what the men in their lives do #EverydaySexism

item.title: RT by @EverydaySexism: Currently only women in Northern Ireland have protected human right to an abortion in law. I will be tabling amendment to forthcoming UK bill of rights to guarantee this for all UK women. If you want your MP to vote for it - as will be free vote- tell them! #nowforUK
item.dc:creator: @stellacreasy
item.description: Currently only women in Northern Ireland have protected human right to an abortion in law. I will be tabling amendment to forthcoming UK bill of rights to guarantee this for all UK women. If you want your MP to vote for it - as will be free vote- tell them! #nowforUK

item.title: RT by @EverydaySexism: Abortion restrictions are never really about believing foetuses deserve to be treated as human beings. They are about believing women do not. https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-61928898 #everydaysexism

item.description: Abortion restrictions are never really about believing foetuses deserve to be treated as human beings. They are about believing women do not. bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-cana‚Ä¶ #everydaysexism

item.description:
Looking for a charity to support this #RefugeeWeek? There are some amazing orgs working in the #VAWG sector, here are just a few:
@SBSisters
@lawrsuk
@LAWALondon
@IKWRO
You can also follow #StepUpMigrantWomen for news and campaigns üëè

item.title:
RT by @EverydaySexism: üö®BREAKING: the Government have launched a brazen attack on our fundamental rights.
‚ö†Ô∏èThe #RightsRemovalBill erodes state accountability for violence against women and girls.
‚úäWe are in solidarity with the many voices - in the women's sector and beyond - in opposing it.
item.dc:creator: @rightsofwomen
item.description:

‚ö†Ô∏èThe #RightsRemovalBill erodes state accountability for violence against women and girls.

item.title:
RT by @EverydaySexism: üì¢We are under no illusion that this is an attempt to weaken the rights to which we are all entitled, and any suggestion that these changes will support survivors of violence against women and girls is deeply disingenuous.
#RightsRemovalBill #SaveYourRights

item.description:

item.title:

The VAWG sector is united against it!

item.title: RT by @EverydaySexism: Our policy and research lead, Dr Hannana Siddiqui, is to give evidence to the Justice Committee today on the draft Victims' Bill, calling for a firewall to stop data sharing between the police & Immigration Enforcement to enable migrant women to report abuse. (1/3)
item.dc:creator: @SBSisters
item.description:
Our policy and research lead, Dr Hannana Siddiqui, is to give evidence to the Justice Committee today on the draft Victims' Bill, calling for a firewall to stop data sharing between the police & Immigration Enforcement to enable migrant women to report abuse. (1/3)

item.title: RT by @EverydaySexism: We stand with rape victims and survivors, >@RapeCrisisEandW @centreWJ and countless others demanding an end to victim-blaming and for @CPSUK to reverse the new guidance and #KeepCounsellingConfidential
item.dc:creator: @EVAWuk
item.description: We stand with rape victims and survivors, @RapeCrisisEandW @centreWJ and countless others demanding an end to victim-blaming and for @CPSUK to reverse the new guidance and #KeepCounsellingConfidential

item.title:
RT by @EverydaySexism: New @CPSUK guidance doesn't apply to perpetrators, only victims - reinforcing the message that it is survivors under investigation.
This will stop survivors accessing support and cause trauma to those going through the courts #KeepCounsellingConfidential https://www.endviolenceagainstwomen.org.uk/new-cps-guidance-will-block-rape-victims-from-therapy/
item.dc:creator: @EVAWuk
item.description:
New @CPSUK guidance doesn't apply to perpetrators, only victims - reinforcing the message that it is survivors under investigation.

This will stop survivors accessing support and cause trauma to those going through the courts #KeepCounsellingConfidential
endviolenceagainstwomen.org.‚Ä¶

item.dc:creator: @Mairi
item.description:
Maria Grey addressed the RSA 151 years ago. And we‚Äôre still debating ‚Äúthe women‚Äôs question‚Äù today. As Maria would say, time to fix the system, not the women.
@EverydaySexism founder Laura Bates in conversation w/@DrPragyaAgarwal NOW
bit.ly/3NYSpP6 #RSAgenderinjustice

item.title:
RT by @EverydaySexism: 'These are not isolated incidents. They are the opposite. And the opposite of an isolated incident is a pattern.'
Combining stories with shocking evidence, @EverydaySexism's Fix the System, Not the Women is a blazing examination of sexual injustice and a rallying cry for reform.
item.dc:creator: @simonschusterUK
item.description:
'These are not isolated incidents. They are the opposite. And the opposite of an isolated incident is a pattern.'

Combining stories with shocking evidence, @EverydaySexism's Fix the System, Not the Women is a blazing examination of sexual injustice and a rallying cry for reform.

item.title: Today we‚Äôre joining @ICChangeUK in calling on Govt to ratify the #IstanbulConvention without reservations to protect ALL women from violence. They must not cut off migrant women from this lifeline. @pritipatel #AllWomenMeansAllWomen
item.dc:creator: @EverydaySexism
